author: Staff Reporter
text:
The election control room at the Collectorate has so far received 91 complaints and action has been taken on 84 complaints, District Electoral Officer and Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy said here.

He along with officials inspected the election control room at the District Supply and Consumer Protection office in the first floor. All the election vehicles were fitted with GPS tracking device. Hence, the Collector monitored the movement of the vehicles and their stationary points. Addressing the media, Mr. Dakshinamoorthy said that the public and political parties can call the toll free number 1800-425-7021 and lodge election related complaints round the clock. He said that complaints received through the toll free numbers were registered and forwarded to the election officials for necessary action. The control room was functioning from March 4 and so far it has received 91 complaints. Action has been taken on 84 complaints and action is being taken on the remaining ones.

District Revenue Officer K. Palanisamy, PA to Collector (Development) and Election Con trol Room Supervisor Leelakumar were present.
title: Election control room receives 91 complaints
